She studied under Susann McDonald at the Indiana University School of Music, where she received Bachelor and Artist Diploma degrees. Hainen holds the Maryjane Mayhew Barton Chair in Harp Studies for the Curtis Institute of Music and also serves as Artistic Director for Harp at Boyer School of Music, Temple University. As Founding Artistic Director of the Lyra Society, an organization to promote new works for the harp and educate young harpists, she has provided educational outreach to hundreds of school children in urban Philadelphia. Click here to read more. Emmanuel Ceysson is Associate Artistic Director of the USAIHC. Born and raised in France, he was admitted unanimously as a student of the prestigious Paris Conservatoire at the age of 16, and over the succeeding 10 years collected the highest international distinctions and prizes. He teaches masterclasses worldwide, leading a pro-bono harp development program for Latin America in Colombia, serving as a visiting professor at the London Royal Academy of Music, and the Sibelius Academy in Helsinki, Finland, and leading his harp studios at the New York Mannes School of Music. Click here to read more. Mission The USA International Harp Competition exists to inspire, promote, and sustain artistic excellence while fostering a broader appreciation of the harp and its repertoire. Bringing people together through the universal language of music, we enhance international and community relationships by producing our harp competition, composition contest, concert series, and educational programs. Competition Videos Visit our Youtube channel to view the USAIHC video collection. VIDEOS More than the Gold Founded in 1989 by Susann McDonald, the USAIHC is known as the foremost solo harp competition in the world, but it is so much More than the Gold . The video details the four core programs which make up the USAIHC, and also highlights our invaluable community engagement in our Host Families program. Enjoy learning about our: Solo Performance Competition USAIHC Ruth Inglefield Composition Contest Harp Start educational program Concert Series Community engagement - Host Families Dream with US(AIHC) At all levels of the USA International Harp Competition, from our Stars of Tomorrow performers to our forty contestants, dreams are what fuel each individual to reach their personal best. The USAIHC’s four programs – the Solo Harp Performance Competition, the USAIHC Ruth Inglefield Composition Contest, Harp Start educational program, and Concert Series – are the framework that allow dreams to flourish and be shared. Our Competition and Composition Contest provide the opportunity for harpists and composers to make their dreams become reality, while Harp Start and our Concert Series share these dreams with people of all ages and backgrounds through culturally enriching performances. Dream with us and consider making a donation to the USA International Harp Competition! USA International Harp Competition, Inc. P.O. Box 5008, Bloomington, IN 47407      +1 (812) 856-5715        harpcomp@iu.edu

ABOUT US | Welcome to Harper's! top of page HOME WHAT'S NEW Special Event ABOUT US MENUS BEER EVENTS APPLY NOW MERCHANDISE LOCATION & CONTACT Menus (New) More... Use tab to navigate through the menu items. About Us! Harper’s Restaurant & Brewpub was founded September 6, 1997 and named after Thomas Harper O’Brien, a graduate from the Michigan Agricultural College (M.S.U.). He’s the father of Trisha O’Brien Riley another Spartan grad. Born in East Lansing. Trisha and her husband Pat bought Dooley’s in East Lansing to build the first brewpub and music venue to encompass Tom’s passion for enjoying the company of others, especially fellow Spartans. This passion drove him to recruit high school players for the M.S.U. football program, so much so, that when it was deemed that only students could help recruit, Tom went back to school at the age of 70. Today, Harper O’Brien Riley, Tom’s grandson, carries on his legacy as a true Spartan combining his love for the community with his commitment to real hospitality. This East Lansing neighborhood gathering place is truly a family affair, beginning with the Riley family, Pat, Trisha, Brittlyn (Richard), Chanelle (Michael) and Harper, laying all of the ceramic tiles on the floors and walls, to operating the business or making creative elements for the overall décor. Shelly Toth (Financial Manager), Kirk Kowalski (brewmaster), Zulma Ayala and Allen Hines (kitchen leadership team) are Harper’s extended family, ready to serve each and every customer with a smile. Along with this service comes great fun food, exclusive beer and drinks, and dancing too! Couple this loyal and devoted team with approximately 80 other ready-to-serve team players and you have a true team of professionals ready to make your day better and brighter. We Welcome Feedback Rate Us Pretty bad Not so good Good Very good Awesome Rate Us Send Thanks for submitting! ONLINE SHOP LOCATION & CONTACT CONTACT US 131 Albert Ave. East Lansing, MI 48823 E  / Harpersbrewpub@aol.com ​T  /  517-333-4040 OPENING HOURS Every day: 12:00pm-2:00am ©2020 Harper's Restaurant and Brewpub bottom of page

The Irish Harp Pub – Home Is Where The Harp Is Home Menu Entertainment Rooms Merchandise E-Gift About Contact Home Menu Entertainment Rooms Merchandise E-Gift About Contact RESERVATIONS NOTL Golf Tournament CLOSED Shaw Express Menu Make A Reservation Humane Society 50/50 Music Trivia Unplugged Patio Blues Night Live Music Open Mic Night Date Night Trad Sessions Bingo Night CLOSED Bring Fido European Football HOME IS WHERE THE HARP IS Welcome To THE IRISH HARP PUB A Message From The Founder In 2005, the heritage building that is now ours was a neglected and vacant wreck. However, I decided to take on the restoration of the site and lovingly reproduce an authentic Irish Pub in beautiful Niagara-on-the-Lake. This fourteen-month project involved shipping the entire pub and restaurant contents from Ireland. What you see today is the award-winning "Irish Harp Pub". Our mission is to bring you not only the true "Irish Experience" which is great food and beer, but most of all that unique Irish atmosphere and friendliness. All my staff is committed to making your visit to "The Harp" really special. Our extensive menu of home-style cooked food and a wide selection of beers and whiskies will hopefully make your visit memorable. The Irish Harp is proud to have been awarded many accolades over the years, and our constant objective is to improve our services to you on a daily basis. From my General Manager to my kitchen staff, we constantly strive to bring you a "wee bit of Ireland" here in the prettiest town in Canada - Niagara-on-the-Lake. Enjoy your visit - and as we say in Ireland, "May the wind always be at your back and the road ahead be straight and narrow". Trevor Smyth - Founder of the Irish Harp Pub From County Derry, N.
